decks.notes: The deck focuses on applying early pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and discard spells. It aims to control the tempo of the game by using efficient removal and protection spells, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to quickly close out the game. The mana base is designed to ensure consistency and flexibility, with a focus on disruption and aggression. The deck aims to win through a combination of early aggression and disruption, punishing opponents for slow starts or misplays.

The main focus of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. By controlling the board and denying the opponent resources, the deck aims to out-value and outlast the opponent until it can establish a dominant position and secure the win. With a mix of powerful creatures, card advantage engines, and versatile spells, the deck is designed to adapt to various matchups and handle a wide range of threats effectively.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive set of creatures while disrupting their game plan with counterspells and removal spells. It leverages powerful card advantage engines like Brainstorm and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to maintain tempo and outvalue the opponent. By combining aggressive threats with efficient control elements, this deck can put pressure on the opponent while still being able to answer threats and disrupt their plays. The deck's mana base is carefully crafted to support its color requirements and maximize its consistency and efficiency.

This deck focuses on aggressive gameplay using cheap and efficient creatures like Cori-Steel Cutter and Dragon's Rage Channeler to quickly pressure the opponent. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Daze and Force of Will to protect its threats and control the board. Card selection and manipulation are key components with cards like Brainstorm and Ponder to ensure consistent draws. The deck also includes burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Brazen Borrower to finish off the opponent quickly. Finally, land destruction with Wasteland is used to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to aggressively control the game with efficient creatures like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler, supported by a wide range of counterspells like Daze, Force of Will, and Force of Negation. Lightning Bolt and Unholy Heat provide direct removal, while cards like Brainstorm, Ponder, and Mishra's Bauble help with card selection and staying ahead in tempo. The deck also includes land disruption with Wasteland and tempo plays with Brazen Borrower. Overall, the deck aims to establish an early advantage and maintain pressure on the opponent.

The deck focuses on aggressive strategies using creature cards like Guide of Souls, Mockingbird, and Ocelot Pride to quickly overrun the opponent. It also includes disruption cards like Containment Priest, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Quantum Riddler to control the game. The deck runs a high number of counterspells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is built around fetching lands with Flooded Strand, Marsh Flats, and other fetch lands to ensure smooth mana development. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain control throughout the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on using powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm and disrupt opponents. The deck utilizes cards like Chalice of the Void to shut down low-cost spells, and Thought-Knot Seer to disrupt the opponent's hand. The deck also includes mana ramp cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to accelerate the deployment of Eldrazi threats. With a mix of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells, this deck aims to apply constant pressure on the opponent while controlling the battlefield with powerful Eldrazi creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to accelerate mana production and card draw by utilizing the synergy between Elves and various combo pieces like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid. The deck aims to build a critical mass of creatures on the board quickly, and then finish off the opponent with a powerful finisher like Craterhoof Behemoth or Natural Order. The deck utilizes Green Sun's Zenith to tutor for specific creatures as needed, and Once Upon a Time for additional consistency. Overall, the deck focuses on explosive plays and overwhelming the opponent with a fast combo finish.

This deck is focused on quickly filling up the graveyard with powerful creatures like Archon of Cruelty and Atraxa, Grand Unifier, and then bringing them back to the battlefield with cards like Reanimate and Animate Dead to overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Daze to protect the combo pieces and ensure a smooth execution of the reanimation strategy. The mana base is designed to support the deck's mana requirements while also having Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the Cephalid Breakfast combo by using cards like Shuko, Cephalid Illusionist, and Nomads en-Kor to mill cards from your library, putting Narcomoeba and eventually Thassa's Oracle onto the battlefield to win the game. The deck also features disruptive elements like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and deal with opposing threats. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and interaction with the combo pieces, allowing for a fast and consistent win condition in a Legacy 1 vs 1 format.

The primary strategy of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Daze, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Orcish Bowmasters. The deck focuses on tempo plays, using cards like Brazen Borrower and Murktide Regent to apply pressure and maintain a fast pace. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and utility, helping to dig for key cards like Force of Will. The land base includes Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base and enable tempo advantages.

The deck focuses on using "Show and Tell" to put powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn into play for free, thanks to cards like Omniscience. The deck also features ways to protect the combo with counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. Other key cards like Atraxa, Grand Unifier and Lórien Revealed provide additional utility and protection. The deck aims to quickly assemble the combo and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats while controlling the board with disruptive spells.
